section.title: Dependency tags
section.p: With help of the sme-dep.rle-file the CG output is turned into dependency trees. Each token gets a number (#) and the a dependency link specifying a target head (->). The CG verb tags are substitued with other tags. Here is an example:
section.source: "<Go>" "go" CS @CVP #1->3 "<olbmot>" "olmmoš" N Pl Nom @SUBJ> #2->3 "<jaskkodit>" "jaskkodit" <mv> V IV Ind Prs Pl3 @FS-STA #3->0 "<,>" "," CLB #4->4 "<de>" "de" CS @CVP #5->7 "<sáhpánat>" "sáhpán" N Pl Nom @SUBJ> #6->7 "<álget>" "álgit" V IV Ind Prs Pl3 @FAUX #7->3 "<jurdit>" "jurdit" <mv> V TV Inf @IMV #8->7 "<.>" "." CLB #9->9
section.p: Our dependency structure is based upon a compromise between the Sámi grammatical tradition and the conventions used within the visl project.

section.title: The verb tags
section.p: The Sámi disambiguation file sme-dep.rle adds dependency tags to each cohort. The CG verb tags are substituted with these tags:
There are main verbs and auxiliary verbs.
In main clauses: Finite main verb and auxiliary verb, and infinite main verb and auxiliary verb.
@FS is a finite verb in a subclause. The first one in a subclause which functions as a statement, the latter one in a relative subclause.
These are infinite main verbs and auxiliary verbs in an ordinary subclause and in a relative subclause.
These are the verbs of infinite subclauses.
